problems.title: The Earliest Moment When Everyone Become Friends
problems.statement: Find the earliest time when all nodes in a network become connected.
problems.example_explanation: At time 20190211, all nodes become connected for the first time.

problems.title: Redundant Connection
problems.statement: Given edges of a graph, return the edge that creates a cycle.
problems.example_explanation: Edge [2,3] introduces a cycle in the graph.

problems.title: Number of Islands II
problems.statement: Return the number of islands after each land addition.
problems.example_explanation: Each land addition may merge or create new islands dynamically.

problems.title: Number of Operations to Make Network Connected
problems.statement: Return the minimum number of operations needed to connect all computers.
problems.example_explanation: One extra cable can be reused to connect the remaining computer.

problems.title: Number of Connected Components in an Undirected Graph
problems.statement: Count the number of connected components in an undirected graph.
problems.example_explanation: Nodes {0,1,2} form one component and {3,4} form another.

problems.title: Number of Provinces
problems.statement: Return the number of connected components in an adjacency matrix.
problems.example_explanation: There are two separate provinces in the graph.

problems.title: Surrounded Regions
problems.statement: Capture all regions surrounded by 'X' on a board.
problems.example_explanation: Only regions completely surrounded by 'X' are flipped.

problems.title: Number of Islands
problems.statement: Count the number of islands in a 2D grid.
problems.example_explanation: Two disconnected groups of land exist.

problems.title: Clone Graph
problems.statement: Return a deep copy of an undirected graph.
problems.example_explanation: All nodes and edges are duplicated without sharing references.

problems.title: Course Schedule
problems.statement: Determine if all courses can be finished given prerequisites.
problems.example_explanation: Course 0 can be completed before course 1.

problems.title: Course Schedule II
problems.statement: Return a valid order to complete all courses.
problems.example_explanation: One valid topological ordering is returned.

problems.title: Network Delay Time
problems.statement: Return the time it takes for all nodes to receive a signal.
problems.example_explanation: All nodes receive the signal after 2 units of time.

problems.title: Cheapest Flights Within K Stops
problems.statement: Find the cheapest flight price within at most K stops.
problems.example_explanation: The cheapest path uses one stop via node 1.

problems.title: Flood Fill
problems.statement: Fill a connected region with a new color.

problems.title: Shortest Path in Binary Matrix
problems.statement: Find the shortest path from top-left to bottom-right in a binary matrix.
problems.example_explanation: A valid path exists using diagonal movement.

problems.title: Rotting Oranges
problems.statement: Return the minimum time required to rot all oranges.
problems.example_explanation: All fresh oranges rot in 4 minutes.

problems.title: Pacific Atlantic Water Flow
problems.statement: Find cells where water can flow to both the Pacific and Atlantic oceans.
problems.example_explanation: These cells can reach both oceans following height constraints.

problems.title: All Paths From Source to Target
problems.statement: Return all possible paths from source to target in a DAG.
problems.example_explanation: All valid paths from node 0 to node 3 are returned.

problems.title: Word Ladder
problems.statement: Return the length of the shortest transformation sequence from beginWord to endWord.
problems.example_explanation: The shortest transformation sequence length is 5.
